text: Hey, everyone. Does anyone know of a resource that provides some guidance with using context/providers in CMS-React. I have seen some discussions in this group, but I was hoping there was a resource I could reference.

Hi everyone, what is the best practice way of preloading images in modules. This works for me, but it's a bit weird. Specifically, the link is different in the javascript logic from the jsx so I have to replace the start of the link. Presumably, something to do with server-side rendering?

I feel like I'm missing something because preloading is such an important thing. Is there a hook that preloads images that I just haven't found? Or a way to ensure images are preloaded for custom components in the HubSpot app itself?


`const displaySrc = imageSrc.replace(`
    `"<http://20646833.fs1.HubSpotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/20646833|20646833.fs1.HubSpotusercontent-na1.net/hubfs/20646833>",`
    `"<http://rosterlab.com/hubfs|rosterlab.com/hubfs>"`
  `);`

`useInlineHeadAsset(() => <link rel="preload" as="image" href={displaySrc} />); // Preload LCP`

`...`

`<img`
    `src={imageSrc}`
    `alt="RosterLab intro"`
    `className={styles.introImg}`
`/>`
